page.title: 10Turnditch + Windley W.I.
page.content: There are approximately 30 members of our local Women's Institute. This branch started 63 years ago. There are twelve members of the Committee. The Officers this year are Mrs.J.Little (Secretary), Mrs.P.Hanshaw (Treasurer) and Mrs.J.Hurlstone (President). There are elections each year. They meet on the second Wednesday of each month in the W.I.Hut. Usually there is some business to discuss , but then there is probably a speaker who talks about and/or demonstrates their own particular skill. The idea is to educate country women in crafts cookery and general knowledge. In May, they held their meeting in school so that the children could demonstrate their skill on the handbells which belong to the W.I.. They are going to come again in January for handbells but also to see how we use computers.
